TopicTitle: [1.4.3]ALCOR,"Advanced Landing Capsule for Orbital Rendezvous" by ASET (08/02/2017)

Articles.Content:
Right, then. As nervous as I am about sharing vehicles I've made (for fear people will realise what crap they are), I present to you the Alcor LEM. This is my first general release, so please be kind. If you can't be kind, be swift.

Many, many thanks to Alexustas for creating this magnificent lander pod, and Mihara for his data readout plugin!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Mods required:

Alcor landing capsule (obviously)

KOSMOS (fuel lines and spotlights)

AIES (landing gear, engines, RCS, batteries, large antenna, decoupler)

SpaceFactory PPTS (small dish antenna)

NovaPunch (small fuel tanks)

KW Rocketry (heavy struts)

The panels and descent stage framework parts are all stock.

Vehicle weight (not including tasty snacks and assorted lovely beverages): 6.72 tons

And the .craft file for the brave souls who wish to fly this beastie: Alcor LEM craft file

I tested Mun landings from 50km, 105km, and 125km. All were nominal. You should be able to set her down with a bit of fuel left in the descent tanks, if you haven't tried making any sizeable plane changes with only the LEM. Use only as directed. Some small parts make pose a choking hazard. Warranty void if used for more than looking at under flattering lighting.

Thanks for the craft file. I am most certainly going to use this for a munar expedition. Thanks again!
Noticed a small bug on my end. The parts I've tried so far seem to leave a bit of a gap on the top attachment node:

Noticed a small bug on my end. The parts I've tried so far seem to leave a bit of a gap on the top attachment node:

hmm...

is that v0.5?

Do you have the same node definitions?

// --- node definitions ---
// definition format is Position X, Position Y, Position Z, Up X, Up Y, Up Z
node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -0.615, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 2
node_stack_top = 0.0, 0.87, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 2

Tried out the new capsule last night and it's amazing!

You should consider making a rover body like the demv ant that matches the alcor, that would make my KSP life complete!

Alexustas , this is just awesome you and Ledenko (apollo-style capsule) just made my day (just found both your mods simultaneosly) . I know what I will fly around the next time. Keep up that good work

Noticed a small bug on my end. The parts I've tried so far seem to leave a bit of a gap on the top attachment node:

Mind you, the batteries are themselves off and gappy, particularly the biggest one.

This ALCOR... Wow... And yet again today I am stunned with amazement... A week of daily grind, but everything today makes me feel amazed. I think the only way to top this would be if the cat brought me a beer from the fridge.
Never, NEVER, let the cat bring you a beer..... They will always shake it up and then just sit back and watch......
I really can't get enough of this lander pod.

Introducing a new type of indicators -- variable-driven alarm lights.

Now the only thing we're really missing are cockpit sounds
Amazing work! This pod just gets better and better with every iteration.

Now the only thing we're really missing are cockpit sounds

KSP Custom Sounds does this, at least for random beeps and background noise. Not sure if it can handle something like an alarm.

The pod looks great, by the way! Any plans to create a lander module for it?
Aaaaaaaand .... Flight Log! ))
Amazing! Do you have any plans to replace the navball with a PFD maybe?

Amazing! Do you have any plans to replace the navball with a PFD maybe?

It's proving to be complicated, so the answer is "maybe".

First, I need to work out a way to do background handlers the same way as page handlers like this flight log work.

It's proving to be complicated, so the answer is "maybe".

First, I need to work out a way to do background handlers the same way as page handlers like this flight log work.

Well if you could get it to work like the monitors do, regardless of the graphic resolution that would be really swell. Looking forward to further updates!
Now you just need a YouTube client so we can record our Kerbals watching a livestream of themselves.

Well if you could get it to work like the monitors do, regardless of the graphic resolution that would be really swell. Looking forward to further updates!

If I'm doing it at all, it's probably going to work in exactly the same way as the monitors do. Which is why the notion of a page handler. The flight log is technically a separate plugin that the display controller calls for data when it's rendering a specific page -- switch to a different page and it goes to sleep. If I can do the same for images, it'll be easy to draw whatever -- starting with the SCANsat map, most likely, but a PFD will not be out of the question at all.

Now you just need a YouTube client so we can record our Kerbals watching a livestream of themselves.

That might actually be easier than you'd think, Unity can play movies, but the framerate would be a slideshow...

If I'm doing it at all, it's probably going to work in exactly the same way as the monitors do. Which is why the notion of a page handler. The flight log is technically a separate plugin that the display controller calls for data when it's rendering a specific page -- switch to a different page and it goes to sleep. If I can do the same for images, it'll be easy to draw whatever -- starting with the SCANsat map, most likely, but a PFD will not be out of the question at all.

This would be amazing, I have a older computer so I can't really use the interior navball to well, having a display would make it instantly better for me. Really loving this capsule, any plans for a different on that is not so much used for Lunar activities?

Oh NO.... With all of the warping and what not... What happens when Jeb and Bill watch the late night news and see that they are about to die a fiery horrible death 20 minutes in the future???

Ugly......But sounds like really great fun........
